SENT.plain: The author reports on a number of cases of bilateral papilledema of unknown etiology
The condition was presumably caused by a formen virus infection
The symptoms were indicative of increased intracranial pressure; the possibility of a brain tumor therefore had to be ruled out
The results of the neurological examinations were negative and a benign intracranial hypertension was diagnosed
In 20 out of 22 cases neither lasting disturbances of visual nor visual field defects developed as a result of conservative treatment
In two cases--children in whom therapy was only instituted at a late stage--a partial atrophy of the optic nerve developed in spite of the treatment
